utterance.speaker: OPERATOR
utterance.content: 911, what’s your emergency?

utterance.speaker: OPERATOR
utterance.content: Hello? Is there anybody there? Do you need assistance? Are you in danger?

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, what if it rains?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: On our wedding day?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s supposed to be good luck. But we’ll find a venue that has an indoor area, just in case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Even if we find the perfect place it’s not going to be available until at least October.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: October. Harvest season. Perfect.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Perfect, except if you want my dad to walk me down the aisle. He’s going to be in Europe on the research project.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Fine. We’ll have a winter wedding.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did we say we wanted to do it outside?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. Yeah. Frostbite isn’t very festive. How about we get hitched … uh … spring of next year?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what if I want to get married sooner?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who could blame you?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: You two are so adorable.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? Maybe we can find a venue for this summer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You want to have a wedding in the middle of a New York summer?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. You’re right. Oh, I know. September! It’s not too hot, it’s not too cold. It’s right in the goldilocks zone. It’s perfect.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It is, except I’ll be out of town every weekend on my book signing tour. So unless we get married on a Monday, September’s going to be tough.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: A little unsolicited advice –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you give another kind?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: In life, there is no such thing as a perfect time for anything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry, that’s advice how?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Don’t wait. Hell, just go down to city hall right now. You love each other. Stop talking about it. Just do it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ll find a …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let’s keep looking.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: … yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, Castle. Maybe we’re being too ambitious. Maybe we should consider the spring of next year.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I thought you didn’t want to wait that long?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I just – – I want to be flexible.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You already are flexible. You see what I did there?

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s so funny?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well actually, did you know Beckett can lift her –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Nothing. Hello. Nothing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll tell you later.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, our victim is a Ted Rollins. He was shot twice in the chest. He was 20 years old, lived alone, and worked part time at a secondhand record store.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So how does a 20 year old who sells used records for a living own a place like this?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s just one of the many things that don’t add up here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like why he’s soaking wet?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: The killer left Ted Rollins’ body in the shower. When officers arrived the water was still going.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And who called them in?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s a good question. At 11:50 uniforms responded to a 911 call made from the victim’s cell phone.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: But the time of death is between 8 and 11, so there’s no way Ted could have placed that call.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So the killer shot him … and then called 911?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Except our victim was not shot in this apartment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And how do we know that?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Because he has exit wounds in his back, but there are no bullets in the bathroom or anywhere else in the apartment. Plus lividity indicates the body was moved.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so then the killer put him in the shower to wash off the trace evidence from the original crime scene.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: And it almost worked, except for this. Grease here, with the tiny red specks. Water didn’t get that out. It’s on his knees and his elbows. I’m thinking he fell when he got shot and landed in that stuff.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Get this material to CSU. See if they can tell us where he was killed.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t get it. Why would the killer risk moving the body back here from the crime scene?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sounds like a case of Weekend At Bernie’s gone wrong. No. No, wait. That would mean there’s such a thing as Weekend At Bernie’s gone right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute. These two shoelaces are tied differently.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That is odd.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is even more odd.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like Ted’s got a secret compartment. And what’s a secret compartment without a secret? A laptop. The key to our mystery and the identity of our killer may lie within that device.

utterance.speaker: TECH AGENT TORI
utterance.content: Well if it does, I can’t get to it. Honestly I’ve never seen anything like this before.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what are we looking at here?

utterance.speaker: TORI
utterance.content: A very high level encryption program.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: One you can’t crack? C’mon genius girl, I thought you were the best.

utterance.speaker: TORI
utterance.content: I am. It’s just whoever designed this is – – better. But give me some time, let me see what I can do.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anyone else wondering what a record store clerk is doing with this kind of technology?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo, did you contact next of kin?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Ted’s father and little brother. They’re on their way down.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Rollins, when you spoke with our son did he seem worried or scared about anything?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe you could help us with something else. We found a laptop in one of the floorboards at Ted’s place with a highly sophisticated encryption system. Either one of you know what it was doing there?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: GRANT
utterance.content: More like a genius.

utterance.speaker: GRANT
utterance.content: He’d call it ‘pulling a Robin Hood’. Because he would steal from the rich and give to the poor.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The poor being Ted?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So how much did he end up stealing?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Whoa.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is there anything to indicate that he went back to committing identity theft?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay, so let’s just say he went back to stealing identities. Does that explain why he was killed? Yeah, people get pissed about getting their identities stolen, but normally they report it to the police.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well maybe he stole from the kind of people that don’t report to the police.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey! Look who’s back from paternity leave.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So how’s Sarah Grace?

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, man. I tell you. She is just my perfect little angel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, she’s so cute. Wow.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is it me … or does she look a lot like ESPOSITO?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, she does.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Really, Beckett? I expected that from jackass, but not from you. Anyway, I got that CSU report back. It looks like Ted might have been killed in an auto body shop.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did he even own a car?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, but they identified that sludge on Ted’s clothes as hydraulic fluid mixed with red paint flecks. Now the paint is urethane based with high levels of volatile organic compounds, so it’s most likely from a car painted prior to the 1990s.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, canvass the auto shops near Ted’s place. Maybe he was seen at one of them.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, Beckett. We’ve got something.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now, Ted’s laptop is like Fort Knox on steroids, but Tori found some unscrambled artifacts in the registry to a service set identifier. I don’t know what that means either, but she got really excited about it.

utterance.speaker: TORI
utterance.content: And here’s why. Yesterday at 7:19PM Ted connected to a dedicated server of a private computer network. I traced the network. It belongs to … Universal Banking Solutions. They’re based in Chicago, but have satellite offices all over the world, including Manhattan, which is where Ted connected.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now, according to the website, Universal Banking Solutions handles strategic and tactical procurements for international clients.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what does that mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I – I don’t know. I’m just reading the screen there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so what did Ted do when he connected to the server?

utterance.speaker: TORI
utterance.content: It’s impossible to tell. He could have sent an email or accessed the website.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or he hacked it.

utterance.speaker: TORI
utterance.content: That too. Whatever he did, that was the last time this laptop was used before he died.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so who runs the Manhattan office?

utterance.speaker: TORI
utterance.content: Anderson Cross.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, let’s see if Mr. Cross knows what Ted was up to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, Castle. Maybe your mom’s right. I think eloping is a great idea. There’s no planning, no lists. All we do is we just get married.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, I promise you. There is a perfect date for our perfect wedding and we will find it. Trust me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, wedding humor. Nice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We need to speak with Anderson Cross.

utterance.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
utterance.content: Let me see if he’s available.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: ANDERSON CROSS
utterance.content: Richard, something is about to happen. But you cannot react.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry, who is this?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Lives are at stake. Don’t react.

utterance.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Mr. Cross isn’t picking up. Oh, here he is. Mr. Cross, these people are here to see you.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Hello there. I’m Anderson Cross.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hi, I’m Detective Kate Beckett, NYPD.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Detective Beckett, so nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And uh … this is Richard Castle.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Sorry, I didn’t get the name.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … Richard. Richard Castle.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: So why don’t we go into the conference room where we can talk?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dad?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Not a word.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: So I don’t mean to rush us, but I do have an appointment in a few minutes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually this won’t take very long, Mr. Cross. Um, do you know a man named Ted Rollins?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: No, I – I don’t believe I do. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was murdered last night.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Oh. Okay. I’m not sure what that has to do with me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we believe that he tried to access your network yesterday evening around 7:19. Do you have any idea why he would do that?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Well, as a matter of fact, I just a report from my IT people saying that someone tried to hack into our system … around about that time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what exactly does your company do?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Well, we basically handle multi0million dollar currency transactions for banks, international businesses, foreign countries, and the like.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe Ted was trying to tap in and steal from one of those transactions.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Well if he did, he was quite unsuccessful.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Has anyone tried to hack into your company’s network before?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Oh yes. But we have quite a robust firewall system. It’s never been breached.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um, well, would you mind giving me copies of your incursion reports, along with the ones from last night?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Of course. I’ll send them right over to you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Thank you. Thanks for your time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Mr. Cross, uh … have we ever met before?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: I don’t believe we have.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? Because you just seem so familiar.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh huh.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: I have one of those faces.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um, Lanie’s got something for us. We should go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Not at all. My pleasure.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Okay, so I may know why one of Ted’s shoes was tied differently. The killer was looking for something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: In his shoes?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yep. At the time of his death, Ted had a coin in his right sock. Due to rigor mortis an impression remained, including these faint markings. You see that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Wow.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, Castle. You with us?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah. Of course.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, let me get this straight. So after Ted was shot, the killer took off the shoe and sock, took the coin, and put the shoe and sock back on?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It must have been a valuable coin.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Actually, it wasn’t. I did some enhancement and based on the coin’s diameter and the markings, we’ve identified it as an Iranian rial. Worth less than a penny.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow, an Iranian rial, huh?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle? No theories on international intrigue or covert espionage?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We really don’t have the information to speculate at this point.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Were you able to narrow down where Ted was killed?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: No, but I did check his stomach contents and I can tell you this: approximately 15 minutes before his death Ted at clams and funnel cake. Can you believe that? Ugh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie, you slice open dead people for a living and you’re grossed out by that?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Even I have my limits.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine. Clams and funnel cake. That sounds like he had amusement park food.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. And the hydraulic fluid and red paint on Ted’s clothes? He was at an amusement park and I can tell you which one.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, as a connoisseur of carnie food, there’s only one amusement park that has both fried clams and funnel cake and that park is – Coney Island.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: - Coney Island.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Okay, you two creep me out when you do that shared brain thing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, I – hey, I forgot I – have to – – drop by my publisher’s. We’re going to look at the – at least, there’s another – for the Derrick Storm novels, there’s the gallery …

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, thanks. Hey, Beckett! The head of Coney Island’s maintenance staff said that they only place there would be hydraulic and paint is the repair facility under the rollercoaster.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, let’s have park security check it out for us.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: They have. And they found blood.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, this is definitely where Ted was killed.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why here? What was he up to?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Funnel cake vendor remembers seeing Ted. Said he got his food and walked in this direction.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was he with anyone?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not that he saw.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The killer must have followed him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or maybe they came here to meet.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Then why wouldn’t the killer leave the body here? Why would he drag it all the way back to Manhattan, to the victim’s own apartment?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: To throw us off his trail.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or maybe the killer didn’t want us to find the crime scene because there’s something here that ties him to the murder. Do they have security cameras here?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just that one covering the south entrance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, let’s talk to park security, get them to give us the surveillance footage.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. There you go.

utterance.speaker: HOMELESS GUY
utterance.content: God bless you, man.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Sit behind me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I never thought I’d see you again.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Ted Rollins, your victim. What have you learned?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What have I learned? I’m sorry, until a year ago I had no idea who you were and now you come out of the blue and the only thing you have to say is ‘what have you learned’? How about ‘hello son. How’ve you been?’

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: You’re getting emotional. Now’s not the time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? Because it’s been about 40 years, so when would be a good time?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: With what I do? Never. Or did you forget what happened in Paris?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. How could I forget?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Then stop acting like you did. You know what I do, you know who I am. I let my guard down, people die.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: People like Ted? So who was he really? Who killed him?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: You need to tell me what you know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You don’t trust me.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Trust kills faster than bullets. There’s a storm coming and if I don’t stop it a lot more people are going to die. Just tell me what you know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um … he was shot at Coney Island under the rollercoaster. There was a coin in his sock. An Iranian rial.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Do you have the coin?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. The killer took it. Why would he do that? What does that mean?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: It means I’ve gotta go. If there’s any update, text me. Say you need to meet and I’ll be back here within 30 minutes. Don’t tell anyone about this. About me. Not even your fiancée.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did you know we were engaged?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: I may not be good at it, but I am still your father. Now, keep your mouth shut and try not to get us both killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s wrong? You don’t like the artwork for your graphic novel?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, no, no. It’s great. It’s good. It’s um, - So we were right about Coney Island, huh?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. One mystery solved, only it’s led us to a few new ones. Like what was Ted doing there in the first place.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s weird.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s more than weird. Something bigger’s going on here, don’t you think?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey guys. Come check this out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This is surveillance from the security camera at the entrance of the rollercoaster repair yard. Ted enters alone at 8:47PM.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did anyone enter prior to that?

utterance.speaker: TORI
utterance.content: Nope. But about 15 minutes later at 9:04PM someone does.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait. Zoom in and freeze it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s Anderson Cross. Oh, my God. He’s our killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This whole time it was Anderson Cross. So Ted must have hacked into his system and he decided to take matters into his own hands.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But that doesn’t seem likely. I mean, he … really doesn’t seem the type.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, what are you taking about? He lied to us. He told us he didn’t know Ted, and there he is at the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We don’t actually see him commit murder. There’s a number of entrances to that area but there’s only one camera. It just – – may not be what it seems.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So what, he just happened to be there two hours after Ted hacked his company?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I – see – Anderson Cross as the killer? It’s the obvious choice.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, that’s usually what happens when all the evidence points to a suspect.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We have to get him down here. Pull up everything you can on his company.

utterance.speaker: TORI
utterance.content: This makes no sense.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: TORI
utterance.content: It’s gone. The site’s disappeared. Actually, not just the site. We have no trace of the company.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Find Anderson Cross. Now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who the hell is this guy? He’s obviously not a banker. I know why he looks so familiar.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: To check something.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Pick up, pick up.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Leave a message.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Geez!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Man, bro. Why are you so jumpy?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dude, I’m not. I’m just –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, you will be once you hear what we found. C’mon.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This guy, Anderson Cross, is like a villain out of one of your books. His office was cleared out like he knew we were coming.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There wasn’t a trace of him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nothing. Even his receptionist. She was hired from a temp agency. Just started working yesterday. She doesn’t know jack.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Neither does the building manager. He said that Cross rented the place from him last month, paid for a year’s lease with a cashier’s check so it’s totally untraceable.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Whoever this guy is, he’s in a different league.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ve crossed paths before.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Check this out. Remember this guy? Alexis’s kidnapping last year.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Damn, that’s right. Uh … witnesses kept seeing him pop up at locations associated with her abduction.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: At each one of those locations there was a dead body.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So I sent the video surveillance to a friend of mine in the AG’s office and he got a hit. Now he couldn’t get into details, but he did say that this guy is a former CIA operative.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Former?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. He, uh … he was disowned for an unauthorized assassination. He was sentenced to life, broke out, killed three guys in the process. This guy’s wanted by our government. Now my friend said the rumor is he’s working as a hitman. And if we get eyes on him the AG’s office wants us to call them so they can send in a strike team.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why would a guy like this want to kill Ted Rollins?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: More than that, how are we going to find a former spy? He spent a lifetime covering his tracks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but Ted hasn’t. And somehow they’re connected.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So we should see if Hansel left any breadcrumbs towards our suspect.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We need to retrace every one of Ted’s footsteps. Our killer knew him well enough to know where he lived. I mean, they had to have had previous contact.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, did you ever see this man in Paris?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not that I can remember. Why don’t you text me those sketches? I’ll have Alexis come over, see if she recognizes him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You want me to come along?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, no. No, no. I’ll – uh … call you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So I’m coming up with a bunch of nothing. You?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Check it out. It’s a printout of Ted’s metro card. Check out how he got to Coney Island yesterday.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He swiped his card at the 33rd and Park Avenue South station. Probably took the 6 to the M train. So?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So look at his swipes for the past two weeks.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He kept going back and forth to that subway stop at 33rd and Park.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Exactly. And he didn’t work, live, or know anyone in that area.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right. Let’s get up there and see what he was doing.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah, Richard! You’re home early. Care for a glass of liquefied heaven? Good for your hair, good for your teeth –

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard, what is it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course I believed him. Because he’s my father.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Especially after Paris. Why wouldn’t you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But he used me. To stay ahead of the investigation. To know when to make a run for it. If he’s innocent, why didn’t he show up at the park?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard, look. The only thing we really know about him is that we don’t know him. Me, I had one night with him. You, a day in Paris. Lean on the people you trust. Call Katherine. Tell her what’s going on.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I’ll get that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what if he’s telling the truth?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: And what if he isn’t?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Hello, Martha. It’s been awhile, huh?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: What the hell are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Sorry to miss our meeting, but I was a little busy getting shot.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, my God … come in.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: You look good.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yeah well, you’ve looked better.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, I boiled everything, just like you said. But I have to warn you, my only other experience with surgery involved a board game and a guy whose nose lit up when I made a mistake.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Did you bring the booze?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, no., right here. You want something to dull the pain?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: No. I want you to steady your nerves. Take a swig.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good idea.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Okay, now, make an incision through the wound, about an inch long.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Here you go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. About an inch.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Okay, now here comes the fun part. Carefully, and I do mean carefully, pull the slug out.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: But do me a favor. Try not to make my nose light up, all right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think I have it. Got it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t got it. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Careful, Richard.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Now that you know how not to do it, why don’t you try the other one?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Okay, let me just get you, here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you. Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think I have it. All right … … I have it.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Bravo!

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Real good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Here we go.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Martha, hand me the needle and thread.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Uh … here it is. There we go. You’ve stitched yourself up before, I take it?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: At least this time I’ve got a needle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you want to tell us how you got shot?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Not particularly.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about the three guards you murdered while escaping from prison? You want to tell us about that?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Don’t believe everything you read.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you didn’t kill them?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: I work outside the system, which means I needed an effective cover. Hired assassin, wanted by Uncle Sam? Opens a lot of doors.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Crap.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. So I thought I’d see if Alexis remembers anything more about the man from the sketches.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, about the man in the sketches - … um, there’s something you should know about him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s your future father-in-law.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Nice to see you again, Kate.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Katherine. I want to say this isn’t what it looks like, but it is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was going to tell you, I swear.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When? After you patched him up? Sent him on his merry way? He is wanted by the government. You are harboring a fugitive!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s just his cover.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you know that how? Because he told you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because of Paris and because he’s my father.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He is not your father. He made that choice a long time ago. This man is my suspect. Now you know what I have to do, right?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Boy, she is a spitfire, this one.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: I’m glad we’re on the same side.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who says we’re on the same side?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Sorry, he wouldn’t stay put.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Richard, I need you laptop. Now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, the only thing that you are getting is a ride to my precinct in handcuffs.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: You’re not going to arrest me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? Why?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Because you want answers. And if you take me in you’re not going to get any. The Feds will swoop in, you won’t have anything, and I’ll have lost valuable time. You want Ted’s killer? So do I. But there’s a hell of a lot more at stake than murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then you’re going to have to tell me what it is.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: There was a massive breach at the CIA. Someone hacked the files containing the identities of our deep operatives.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you know who?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: No. But it was an inside job at the highest level. That’s why they called me. Because I’m outside. My orders were to find the mole and recover the files.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What does any of this have to do with Ted?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Ted was one of my best guys. I recruited him to help me find Gemini.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Gemini?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Code name for the mole. He was planning on selling the DCO list. But we couldn’t find him. If these files get out the consequences will be very real. Then yesterday we had a breakthrough. Ted identified the buyer and he signaled me to meet to tell me who it was. But –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But Gemini got there first. He killed Ted.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Leaving me SOL. Until you told me about the Iranian rial.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You – you told him about the rial?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Ted left that as a failsafe message about the buyer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. It’s old school spy craft. But Gemini knows all the old tricks so he took that coin to throw you off his scent.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Yeah. Once I found out the Iranians were involved I traced Ted’s trail back to an apartment on East 38th Street across from the Iranian mission. Only Gemini got there ahead of me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And he ambushed you.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: From a rooftop across the way. As soon as I opened the door all hell broke loose. But I’m good at hell.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: And I made my way back to the car but he was right on my tail. I had to drive right into the East River just to get away from him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, this is an incredible story and I can see where Castle gets his talent, but that doesn’t mean any of what you said is true.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: You don’t believe me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh uh.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Well, turn on the news.

utterance.speaker: NEWSCASTER
utterance.content: A high speed car chase rocked the neighborhood of Murray Hill just hours ago. According to multiple reports, the pursuit began with gunshots at an apartment on East 38th Street, where two unidentified men were involved in a gun battle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That doesn’t prove anything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So, whatever our boy Ted was into, it’s all some crazy ass spy stuff.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What makes you say that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, have you heard about that car chase in Murray Hill? Well, we’re at the epicenter. It’s a shot up apartment at 38th and 3rd. That’s where it all started. According to the super, Ted Rollins rented this place two weeks ago.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: By the looks of the equipment, he was hacking again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hacking who?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t know. He’s got a pretty sophisticated Wi-Fi sniffer here, so he must have been intercepting internet traffic from someone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The Iranian mission across the street.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What exactly did Ted intercept?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t know. Someone stole the hard drive.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Can I borrow your laptop now?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: These are communications to and from the Iranian mission.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s incredibly illegal.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Yep. Okay, here. He’d flagged this one. It’s an anonymous email from Izad Larjani. He’s part of Vivak, Iran’s CIA.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “FC – payment received. Central Library Reading Room. Tomorrow, 5PM. Network name ‘Kingfish’.” This was sent yesterday.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Which means its’ going down today.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s sending the DCO list over a secured Wi-Fi connection in – – roughly 30 minutes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Central Library’s a perfect location. It’s public, uh, there’s lots of people on laptops.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Gemini never has to meet with his buyer face to face.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wi-Fi signals max out at about 200 feet indoors. He and the buyer would have to be in the building at the same time.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Given everything that happened, why would he still go through with the exchange?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: FC means final communication. All links have been severed. If Gemini pulls out, he has no way to tell his buyer. He will do anything in his power to make the transfer. I’ve gotta go. I’ve gotta stop this.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Are you crazy? We just pulled a bullet out of you! Can’t you call someone?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: This mission does not exist. I don’t exist. There’s no one to call?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t you have backup?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: I am the backup.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re in no condition –

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: You don’t understand! This list cannot get out into the open.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then we’ll go. Castle’s right. You’re in no condition. And if we stop him then we all get what we want.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Let’s run this, just so we know we’re all on the same page. Richard, what do you do?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: As soon as the Kingfish network goes online, I log in, I download the list.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: You don’t just log in. You’ve got to be first.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: But why does he have to be first?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because it locks out the Iranians from downloading the list.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right, and while Castle is downloading I’ll track the signal using the Wi-Fi analyzer on my phone.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You can find a spy on your phone?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother, there’s an app for everything now.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Now Kate, remember, if you don’t have a tactical advantage just get eyes on him. He’s CIA. If you can describe him I can find him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Right. It’s almost five. We should go.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Richard. This means a lot, kid.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Martha, I’m going to need –

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I know. He’s not going anywhere.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: If anything happens to them –

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: He’s a smart kid. And she’s good at what she does. No, they’ll be fine. I promise.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Forgive me, but your promises don’t mean very much.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Gemini could be any one of these people.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. Scanning for Wi-Fi signals.

utterance.speaker: BECKET
utterance.content: I don’t see Kingfish.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe we’re too late.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: You still play?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No, not so much anymore.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: A shame. You were good.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: That was a hell of a night.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Hell of a night.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: You remember the song you played? My Funny Valentine?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: It was a long time ago.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, oh, oh. You need to lie down.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: All right. I am calling an ambulance for you.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: No, no. It’s just that my blood sugar’s low. You got any juice.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Uh … yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: 5:04. We blew it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did we? Or did we just get played? Look Castle, I know he’s your father. But what if there’s an ulterior motive to all of this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Kingfish is online. Go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay … T, hashtag, less than, L –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uppercase L.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, capital L …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ve gotta get on before the buyer. C’mon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m in. Downloading the file, slowest speed possible. That gives you … less than three minutes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, you stay here. You tell me how much time I have.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you hear me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. I can hear you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Signal’s getting stronger.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’ve got two minutes, 47 seconds left.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh no.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’ve got under 2 minutes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, Castle. I’m at the stairs and the signal’s gotten weak again. Did I pass him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Wait. We are demonstrating two dimensional thinking here, like Khan in Star Trek 2: Wrath of Khan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Khan didn’t realize that the Enterprise was below him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. So if we are the Enterprise that means Gemini is –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s above us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, this is so not the time, Mother.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A minute fifteen left.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I’m in the book stacks. I’m close.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, less than a minute. Be careful.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mom!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you see him? Is he there?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh no.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, Castle. He set up some kind of a relay system. Gemini could be anywhere.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? Hang on, something’s wrong.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The download is complete, but this is – this is not a CIA list. This is – this is a phone book.

utterance.speaker: TONY BLAINE
utterance.content: Richard Castle? Wow.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: BLAINE
utterance.content: I am so sorry to bother you, sir, but I’m like, your number one fan. Can I get an autograph?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, this is really not a great time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle? Are you there?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That was you at the park, wasn’t it? Dressed as a homeless guy. You’re Gemini.

utterance.speaker: BLAINE
utterance.content: Let’s go. Nice and quiet.

utterance.speaker: BLAINE
utterance.content: The man who sent you, who is he?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, I don’t know what you’re talking about.

utterance.speaker: BLAINE
utterance.content: I saw you in the park with him. Is he CIA?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The phone book. You knew not to send the real list because you were trying to draw him into the open.

utterance.speaker: BLAINE
utterance.content: That’s right. Looks like he was smart enough to send someone expendable. All right, mystery writer, tell me a story. Who’s your handler? What’s his name? Where is he?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why should I tell you? You’re just going to kill me anyway.

utterance.speaker: BLAINE
utterance.content: Yeah, but I can kill you slow or I can kill you fast. It’s up to you.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: You all right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Me? You’re – you’re the one that was shot.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: It wasn’t the first time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll go call an ambulance.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Don’t bother.

utterance.speaker: BLAINE
utterance.content: No! No, wait!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would you do that?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: That was the mission. That’s what I do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did you even find me?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Your left coat pocket.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What is this? Is this some kind of GPS locator? How did you -? The hug. You slipped this on me.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: I needed to keep tabs on you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, to use me as bait!

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: Well after the shootout at the apartment, I knew I was blown. But I still had to recover this list.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So to keep the upper hand you let Beckett and me walk into a trap. We could have been killed.

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: I would never let anything happen to you two.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The way you never let anything happen to Ted?

utterance.speaker: CROSS
utterance.content: There are reasons I have to do, Richard. One day you’ll understand. Hum? Now, get Beckett. Let her know we have our killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, Castle! What happened?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon. Gemini’s down here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. No, no, no, no. He was here. He was here just a minute ago. And of course he took the body.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But left Gemini’s weapon.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That gun was a ballistics match to the one that killed Ted. And it’s registered to Tony Blaine.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We searched his place. Found clothes that tested positive for Ted’s blood. Blaine’s killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But who is he?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He’s a researcher at a government think tank.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, but what a researcher at a government think tank is doing is doing involved in all this, we have no idea.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, we may never know.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, hold on. We’ve got a BOLO out on him and we’re monitoring his credit cards. We’ll find him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And when we do maybe he can tell us who this Anderson Cross is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Maybe. All right. Great job, guys.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, it looks like the CIA wrapped all this up in a neat package.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. With a bow courtesy of my father.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: At least Ted’s killer was brought to justice, you know? In a way.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Blaine killed Ted but left his body at Coney Island. It was my father that moved the body. Now he could have put it anywhere, but he took it to Ted’s apartment. Now do you know why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: To bring him into our jurisdiction.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He wanted us to catch the case so he could work me for information.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well maybe he was just looking for a reason to see you again and this was his way.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I keep making the mistake of thinking he’s family. But he’s not. You are.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: September.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re getting married in September. It won’t be too hot, it won’t be too cold. It’s in the goldilocks zone. It’s perfect.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute, Castle. What about your book tour?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Screw it. September.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello, Mother.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well that was fun. Ugh. What a day. You know, for years I wondered if your father was the one who got away. Well now I finally know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was never worth your time.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh yes he was. First time I met him he gave me the greatest gift of my life. You. And now after all these years he’s given me another one. Closure. Though ­– – what about you, kiddo? How are you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Think we’ll ever see him again?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I wish I knew.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
